document.docAuthor: Zhang, Ruilei, Song, Chao, Wang, Liqing & Wang, Xinhua
document.docTitle: Polypedilum (Tripodura) procerum Zhang, Song, Wang & Wang, 2015, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the acifer species group of Polypedilum subgenus Tripodura Townes from China (Diptera: Chironomidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the acifer species group of Polypedilum subgenus Tripodura Townes from China (Diptera: Chironomidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype (BDN. 21333 ): male. CHINA , Guangdong Province, Fengkai County, Heishiding Natural Conservation,
12 . IV. 1985
, light trap, X. Wang. Paratypes :
2 males
.
1 male
as holotype .
1 male
: Fujian Province, Fuzhou City, on campus of Fuzhou Agricultural College,
22 . IV. 1993
, light trap, X. Wang.
Etymology. The species name is from Latin “ procerus ”, means slender, referring to the thin and slender superior volsella.

Diagnostic characters.
P. ( T .) procerum
sp.n. can be separated from other related species by the following characters: tergite IX subcircular; anal tergite bands very short, gradually narrowed, abruptly terminating at the base of tergite IX; superior volsella S-like, bare and very long, with a hooked apex; inferior volsella slender, uniformly elongated.
Total length 2.03–2.43 mm . Wing length 1.08–1.46 mm . Total length/ wing length 1.57–2.05 . Wing length / length of profemur 2.28–2.43 .
Coloration. Head brown with yellow palpomeres. Thorax brown with darker vittae, postnotum and preepisternum. Abdominal segments entirely yellowish brown. Legs yellowish brown.

Head. AR 0.86–1.24 . Ultimate flagellomere 326–494 µm long. Temporal setae 6–8 . Clypeus with 8–12 setae. Tentorium 88–90 µm long, 21–23 µm wide. Palpomere lengths (in µm): 26 –29, 26–29, 70–81, 73– 104, 112 – 140 .
Thorax. Dorsocentrals 7–9 , acrostichals 9–15 , prealars 2–3 . Scutellum with 3–4 setae.

Legs. Terminal scale (
Fig. 2 B
) of front tibia 31–39 µm long, triangular and apically pointed; spur of median tibiae 31–34 um long including 16–18 µm long comb, un-spurred comb 16–17 µm long, spur of posterior tibia 36–42 µm long including 16–18 µm long comb, un-spurred comb 16–23 µm long. Width at apex of front tibia 31–36 µm, of middle tibia 31–39 µm, of hind tibia 36–47 µm. Lengths (in m) and proportions of legs as in
Table 3
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 3. Lengths (in Μm) and proportions of legs of species
P. ( T. ) procerum
sp. n.
, male.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hypopygium (
Figs. 2 C–D
.). Tergite IX subcircular; anal tergite bands very short, gradually narrowed, interrupted at a long distance from the basal area of anal point. Anal point 40–50 µm long, broad and apically rounded; the lateral projections weak, about 5–8 µm long; dorsally with a V-shaped ridge bearing 5–6 setae on each side. Superior volsella (
Fig. 2 C
) S-shaped, pointed apically, with a hooked apex, nearly reaching apex of anal point and distal part of inferior volsella. Inferior volsella 95–105 µm long, slender, uniformly elongated, curved inwards on its proximal half, distal half straight and uniformly elongated, dorsally with 4–5 orally projected setae, 1 longer apical seta present apically. Gonocoxite 81–107 µm long. Gonostylus 109–138 µm long, narrow at about basal 1 / 4 , medially expanded and gradually narrowed towards apex, with 6 long setae along inner margin. HR 0.71–0.78 , HV 1.66–2.23 .
Distribution. The new species was collected from Fujian and Guangdong Provinces (Oriental China ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2A–D.
Polypedilum
( Tripodura ) procerum
sp. n.
A. Wing. B. Fore tibial scale. C. Superior volsella. D. Hypopygium, dorsal and ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The new species is very close to
P. ( T. ) leptovolsellae
Ree, 2009
and
P . ( T .) pseudacifer
Zorina & Makarchenko, 2001
, in having a long, extremely slender and apically curved superior volsella. The differences between the three species are given in
Table 4
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 4. Main distinguishing characters between
P . ( T .) procerum
sp. n.
,
P. ( T. ) leptovolsellae
Ree
and
P .
( T .)
pseudacifer
Zorina
& Makarchenko
.

sp. n.
leptovolsellae pseudacifer
Fore leg ration 2.30–2.33 1.88 1.88–1.93

tr.th: Spur on scale of fore tibiae
Short setae on apical inner margin of superior volsella

paragraph.keyLead: - Tergite IX with lateral projections or conspicuous shoulders.................................................... 6

2 . Anal point slender and parallel-sided.................................................
P . ( T .) masudai (Tokunaga)

3 . Superior volsella spatula-shaped and inferior volsella with less than 5 setae................
P . ( T .) spathum Zhang & Wang
- Superior volsella pad-like and inferior volsella with more than 10 setae........................................... 4

4 . Terminal scale of fore tibia pointed, distal margin of superior volsella with 2–3 setae, anal point broad, distal part of r 4 + 5 clear..............................................................................
P . ( T .) japonicum (Tokunaga)

- Terminal scale of fore tibia rounded, distal margin of superior volsella with more than 19 setae, anal point spatula-shaped api- cally, distal part of r 4 + 5 cloudy............................................................................ 5

5 . Anal point with 6 setae at base, superior volsella goblet-shaped; gonostylus slender and apex narrowed...................................................................................................
P . ( T .) cypellum Qi
et . al .

- Anal point with 2 rows of short dorsal setae, each row with 8−10 setae; superior volsella pediform; gonostylus moderately broad, apex not narrowed................................................... -
P . ( T .) harteni Andersen & Mendes

- Wing with markings, usually boldly marked with several dark spots and clouds, sometimes faint and restricted in a few areas.................................................................................................... 7

7 . Wing marking faint, without spot in cell r 4 + 5 ................................................
P . ( T .) falcatum
sp. n.
- Wing marking distinct, with more than 1 spot in cell r 4 + 5 ....................................................... 8

8 . Fore tibial scale rounded apically....................................................
P . ( T .) scalaenum (Schrank)

9 . Lateral projections of anal point strongly sclerotized and without microtrichiae........
P . ( T .) nudiprostatum Zhang & Wang
- Lateral projections of anal point covered with microtrichiae................................................... 10

10 . Wing with 3 dark spots in cell r 4 + 5 ...........................................
P . ( T .) decematoguttatum (Tokunaga)

11 . Superior volsella clavate with 2 strong spines directed medially in inner margin...........
P . ( T .) bispinum Zhang & Wang

- Superior volsella pad-like with more than 5 setae directed posteriorly.................
P . ( T .) cochlearum Zhang & Wang
